purpleculture_pinyin:
zhù
to cast or found metals
лить или находить металлы
rtega_mnemonic:
鑄鑄RS
铸铸		鋳melt, cast, coin, mint
  • metal 金 cast for longevity 壽/寿
  • hands and mouth (blowing) 壽/寿 casting metal 金
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 铸)
Pictophonetic: 壽 indicates the sound; 釒 (metal) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
鑄造 [ zhù zào ]: to cast (pour metal into a mold)
鑄成 [ zhù chéng ]: to cast in metal; (fig.) to forge; to fashion
鑄鐵 [ zhù tiě ]: pig iron; foundry iron
鑄幣 [ zhù bì ]: coin; to mint (coins)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 釒 [ jīn ] gold, metal; money
    • 壽 [ shòu ] old age, longevity; lifespan
heisig_chinese_memo: The long gray beard guy has a metal staff which he uses to cast spells.
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: If you want a good piece of metal you'll have get it casted by the long gray beard man.  He's the best.
humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle from " 𦥑 'from the' ◎ 'from the' dish ." " Dish " means the model of casting vessel, and " casting " elephant hands (" 𦥑 ") hold the upside-down pot (" ◎ ") into the model for making the utensil. (Lee Hyo parameter set) "collection" shape of the mouth of the 29,687 increase in human form ( " owe " "), again" nine "(" elbow beside ") make a sound. Qiu Xigui believes that " cast " is a word derived from " zhu ", and the two are closely related in the form of characters, see " zhu ".

Inscriptions from " 𦥑 'from the' Ge 'from the' fire 'from the' dish ." Some glyphs add the symbol " Gold " or the sound symbol " 𠃬 ". " Cast " has another variant called " 𨥇 ", from " gold " to " elbow " sound. There is also a " tide " initial article as a voice. Jiang Yubin believes that it is very likely that the " fire " of " casting " is gradually categorized as a voice.

Chu Department of text from ' 𦥑 ' from the ' fire ' from the ' dish . " The characters of the Qin series change from " gold " to " fire ", with the sound " 𠃬 ". Xiaozhuan sounds from " gold " and " shou ". The original meaning is casting. "Said Wen": "Forging, selling gold. From gold, longevity."

The oracle bone inscriptions use the original meaning, such as "British Tibetan" 2567: "Wang Qizhu Huang Lu Dien 𧖸." " Lu " is a metal cake. Bronze inscriptions also use the original meaning, such as the great tripod in the book: "Gongzhu casts the king of martial arts, and becomes the king of different (sacrifice) tripods." It is also read as " discuss ", which means conquest, such as Qin Gongzhong: "to cast (discuss) hundred mans", meaning That is to conquer hundreds of barbarians. (Jiang Yubin)

" Casting " is also used as the name of the country, such as t-black cast child 𦣞 Ge: "cast child hanging (t) black 𦣞 Zhao (Zhao) Chad (as) Bao Ge." Cast country also see historical documents, such as "Zuo. "Twenty-Three Years of Xianggong": "In the early days, Uncle Zang Xuan married Yuzhu, gave birth to Jia and died for nothing." Du Yu noted: "The country was cast, ruled by Sheqiu County in Jibei." Yang Bojun Note: "Founded at Nanda in Feicheng County, Shandong The north bank of the Wen River."

" Cast " in the handed down literature also means casting, such as "Mandarin. Zhou Yu: "In 21 years of King Jing, he will make big money." "Guan Zi. "Xiao Kuang": "U.S. dollars are used to make wars, swords, spears, and halberds, and all dogs and horses are tested; evil gold is used to make catty, axe, iron, barbarian, saw, and all kinds of wood and earth."

The extension of " casting " means to cultivate and cultivate, such as "Fayan. "Xue Xing": "Confucius casts Yan Yuan." It also refers to tempering words, such as "Wen Xin Diao Long. "Bian Sao": "Look at the bones of the tree, and the skin attached. Although it is based on the edict of the "Sutra", it is also a great speech."
humanum_short_description_en: Oracle from " 𦥑 'from the' ◎ 'from the' dish ." " Dish " means the model of casting vessel, and " casting " elephant hands (" 𦥑 ") hold the upside-down pot (" ◎ ") into the model for making the utensil. The original meaning is casting.
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文從「𦥑」從「◎」從「皿」。「皿」表示鑄器的範，「鑄」象雙手（「𦥑」）持倒置的鎔器（「◎」）倒入製作器物的模型中。（參李孝定）《合集》29687的字形增加了張口的人形（「欠」」），又以「九」（「肘」）作聲旁。裘錫圭認為「鑄」是由「注」孳生的一個詞，兩者在字形上有密切關係，參見「注」。

　　金文從「𦥑」從「鬲」從「火」從「皿」。有的字形又增意符「金」或聲符「𠃬」。「鑄」又有異體作「𨥇」，從「金」，「肘」聲。又有以「潮」的初文為聲，蔣玉斌認為很有可能是「鑄」的「火」旁逐漸類化以具表聲作用。

　　戰國楚系文字從「𦥑」從「火」從「皿」。秦系文字從「金」從「火」，「𠃬」聲。小篆從「金」，「壽」聲。本義是鑄造。《說文》：「鑄，銷金也。从金，壽聲。」

　　甲骨文用本義，如《英藏》2567：「王其鑄黃呂奠𧖸。」「呂」是金屬餅塊。金文亦用本義，如作冊大鼎：「公朿鑄武王、成王異（祀）鼎。」又讀為「討」，表示征討，如秦公鐘：「鑄（討）百蠻」，意謂征討數百個蠻邦。（蔣玉斌）

　　「鑄」也用為國名，如鑄子叔黑𦣞鬲：「鑄子弔（叔）黑𦣞肈（肇）乍（作）寶鬲。」鑄國亦見傳世文獻，如《左傳．襄公二十三年》：「初，臧宣叔娶于鑄，生賈及為而死。」杜預注：「鑄國，濟北蛇丘縣所治。」楊伯峻注：「鑄在今山東肥城縣南大汶河北岸。」

　　傳世文獻「鑄」也表示鑄造，如《國語．周語》：「景王二十一年，將鑄大錢。」《管子．小匡》：「美金以鑄戈、劍、矛、戟，試諸狗馬；惡金以鑄斤、斧、鉏、夷、鋸、欘試諸木土。」

　　「鑄」引申表示造就、培養，如《法言．學行》：「孔子鑄顏淵矣。」又指錘煉文辭，如《文心雕龍．辯騷》：「觀其骨鯁所樹，肌膚所附，雖取鎔《經》旨，亦自鑄偉辭。」
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文從「𦥑」從「◎」從「皿」。「皿」表示鑄器的範，「鑄」象雙手（「𦥑」）持倒置的鎔器（「◎」）倒入製作器物的模型中。本義是鑄造。

Pinyin: zhù
English Definition: to cast or found metals
Total strokes: 22; Radical: 金
Pictophonetic: 壽 indicates the sound; 釒 (metal) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 釒 [ jīn ] gold, metal; money
    • 壽 [ shòu ] old age, longevity; lifespan
Example Words:
鑄造 [ zhù zào ]: to cast (pour metal into a mold)
鑄成 [ zhù chéng ]: to cast in metal; (fig.) to forge; to fashion
鑄鐵 [ zhù tiě ]: pig iron; foundry iron
鑄幣 [ zhù bì ]: coin; to mint (coins)

鑄字的基本解释

鑄
zhù
见“铸”。

鑄字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhù］
［《廣韻》之戍切，去遇，章。］
“铸1”的繁体字。
(1)熔炼金属或以液态非金属材料浇制成器的统称。
(2)陶冶，造就（人才）。
(3)比喻铭记。
(4)锤炼（文辞）。
(5)古国名。今山东肥城南有铸乡，即其旧地。

鑄字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　鑄； 康熙笔画：22； 页码：页1324第23
〔古文〕?【唐韻】之戍切【集韻】朱戍切，?音注。【說文】銷金成器也。【玉篇】熔鑄也。【左傳·宣三年】鑄鼎象物。【註】象所圖物，著之於鼎。又【昭二十一年】天王將鑄無射。　又國名。【左傳·襄二十三年】臧宣叔娶于鑄。【註】鑄國，濟北蛇丘縣所治。　又地名。【後漢·郡國志】濟北國有鑄鄕城。　又與祝通。【禮·樂記】封帝堯之後于祝。【註】祝，或爲鑄。　又姓。【姓苑】堯後。以國爲氏。　又【字彙補】照秀切，音呪。【淮南子·俶眞訓】今夫冶工之鑄器。【註】鑄，讀作祝。

鑄字的源字形

字源演变：

甲骨文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
鑄字的起名意思

暂无。

Cast
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zhù］
["Guang Yun" cut and cut, go to meet, chapter. ]
The traditional characters of "造1".
(1) A general term for smelting metals or casting devices with liquid non-metallic materials.
(2) Cultivating and cultivating (talents).
(3) Remembering metaphorically.
(4) Rehearsal (text).
(5) Ancient country name. Today, there is a township south of Feicheng, Shandong, which is its old place.
Cast
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Su Ji 1] [Golden Word Department] 　 cast; Kangxi strokes: 22; page number: page 1324 to 23
〔古文〕?【Tang Yun】Zhu Qi [Ji Yun】Zhu Shu Qi,? Phonetic Note. [Said Wen] Selling gold into tools. [Jade articles] Casting also. [Zuo Zhuan·Xuan Three Years] Casting tripod elephant objects. [Note] The image is written on the tripod. Also [21 Years of Zhao] the king of heaven will cast no shots.　 Also the name of the country. [Twenty-three years of Zuo Zhuan·Xiang] Uncle Zang Xuan married Yu Zhu. [Note] Zhu Guo, ruled by Sheqiu County, Jibei.　Also place name. [Later Han·Jun Guo Zhi] Jibei State-owned Cast Iron City.　 And Zhu Tong again. [Li·Le Ji] Yu Zhu after Feng Di Yao. [Note] Zhu, or for casting.　Another last name. [Surname Garden] After Yao. Take the country as the clan.　[Word Supplement] According to Xiuqie, the sound is 呪. 【Huainanzi·Fuyixun】The casting of Jinfu smelter. [Note] Cast, pronounced as wish.
